critique: The document is an exemption from compulsory retirement for age for Thomas A. Haigh. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is joy, as the President is allowing Thomas A. Haigh to continue working for another year. There is no sadness, anger, fear, or disgust conveyed in the document. There is a slight surprise conveyed in the document, as the President is making an exception for Thomas A. Haigh.
